item.title: Something for the Weekend – 11/01/25
item.content:encoded:
https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/01/11/something-for-the-weekend-11-01-25/

It’s bloody freezing out and about in the UK right now, so I hope you’re all keeping nice and toasty with some added layers, fashionable scarves and silly bobble hats, as needed. But despite the chill over here, the games industry in doing its stretches and warming up for the year. Things are going to start getting really interesting again in the next few weeks, after the slumber that always settles in over the end of year holidays.

So without much further ado, let’s get to the news…

In the News This Week

  • Rumours suggest more Xbox games will be coming to PS5 and Switch including Halo, Gears and Flight Sim
  • Assassin’s Creed Shadows delayed again to March
  • Marvel Rivals Season 1 called Eternal Night Falls, Fantastic Four join the fight
  • Transformers: Reactivate has been cancelled, staff to be laid off
  • Xbox Developer_Direct stream will feature Doom: The Dark Ages & more on 23rd January
  • The Lenovo Legion Go S will be the first third party SteamOS handheld
  • Hyperkin is remaking the PS5’s DualSense, but for Xbox
  • Monster Hunter Wilds Open Beta 2 is coming in February
  • RGG and Sega share new Virtua Fighter Project pre-development concept video
  • Helldivers and Horizon Zero Dawn movies announced by Sony
  • The Last of Us Season 2 trailer confirms April 2025 release

Games in Review & Featured Articles

There’s a heavy degree of 2024 catchup in our review pool this week, as you’d expect, though we are on to some early 2025 releases.

  • Ys Memoire: The Oath of Felghana – PS5, PS4, NSW – 9/10
  • Songs of Silence – PS5, XSX|S, PC – 8/10
  • Skydance’s Behemoth – PSVR 2, Quest 2&3, SteamVR – 7/10
  • The Edge of Allegoria – PC – 7/10

And we had a new gamepad review as well, which has got a teensy little screen built into it.

  • Manda One – NSW, PC, iOS, Android – 7/10

Away from the reviews, we had one big preview, and it’s a real doozy. Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 is shaping up very, very well after the first 8-10 hours spent with the game. Want to see how it looks on PS5 Pro?

Rounding things out as always, What We Played featured Marvel Rivals, Destiny 2 and Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2.

Most Wanted 2025

Continuing on from the start of the year, we’ve then been looking at our most wanted games of the next twelve months. We’re on the cusp of declaring our top five, which will be broken out over the next working week, but here’s where we’re up to so far:

  • Our Most Wanted Games of 2025 – #50 to #46
  • Our Most Wanted Games of 2025 – #45 to #41
  • Our Most Wanted Games of 2025 – #40 to #36
  • Our Most Wanted Games of 2025 – #35 to #31
  • Our Most Wanted Games of 2025 – #30 to #26
  • Our Most Wanted Games of 2025 – #25 to #21
  • Our Most Wanted Games of 2025 – #20 to #16
  • Our Most Wanted Games of 2025 – #15 to #11
  • Our Most Wanted Games of 2025 – #10 to #6

That’s a lot of big games!

Trailer Park

Atomfall gameplay video delves into the world and dangers

Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii new combat features revealed

The fifth world from Revenge of the Savage Planet has been revealed

Your Achievements

Let’s see what you’ve been up to:

  • Andrewww has been prepping for a house move, so gaming has been limited to just a smidgeon of Astro Bot, which was a Christmas present, and a bit of Life Is Strange: Before The Storm.
  • TSBonyman, meanwhile has been having a blast of nostalgia with RoboCop: Rogue City. The slow movement works for combat, but less so when doing detective work, but it’s really having the authentic likenesses and actors from the original movies represented that does it.

That’s the round up for this week. Hope you have a great weekend ahead!

item.title: What We Played – Marvel Rivals, Destiny 2 & Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2
item.content:encoded:
https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/01/10/what-we-played-marvel-rivals-destiny-2-kingdom-come-deliverance-2/

The first full week of the year definitely picked up the pace again, and there’s been plenty of headlines, new trailers and general stuff happening in video games. And there’s also new games coming out sooner than you might think!

I’ve had an old platformer on the go that you’ll hear about next week, and I also played a few hours of Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 to cobble together a preview video for the game earlier today.

But it’s Gamoc who on point for our Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 review, and it’s his first impressions that we were able to share in our final preview. He’s really been enjoying it so far, so keep your eyes peeled for our review next month! That’s not all he’s been playing, though. There’s also been some bits of Dragon Age: The Veilguard, Black Ops 6, and Terraria with his sister (who’s having to put up with just having a PS4 for the time being).

Jim’s also been playing Kingdom Come… but only the first one – “My enjoyment took a momentary dip during the notoriously dull monastery main quest in which you become a novice monk, performing mundane daily duties while also investigating which of your fellow brothers is a criminal. It was great in terms of historical immersion but was surprisingly punishing. I much preferred my next quest, giving the villagers of Pribyslavitz a good telling off for pooing in the nearby river.”

Aran’s continuing adventures through The Witcher 3 have taken him through Novigrad, where he’s just picking up quests and some Witcher contracts. He’s also been on the sidelines of Football Manager 24, getting Valencia to the Champions League semi finals, but getting knocked out, meaning he’s just got the slimmest of hopes left for a league win if Real Madrid and Barcelona ever slip up.

There’s been a fair bit of Marvel Rivals for Jason, where he’s been having to do an awful lot of carrying as the team healer. Alongside that it’s been Atlyss –  “a very enjoyable MMO-style game with some, uh, very specific character models.”

Nic and his wife have reached the final credits of Animal Crossing: New Horizons, so now there’s just all the catching of fishes, bugs and everything else still to do!

While Dom was feeling like he was going to be crushed under the sheer weight of a Lenovo Legion Go – he is, after all, a very small person, and it is a large handheld – Miguel has been mainlining gacha games including Girls Frontline 2, some Zenless Zone Zero, a pinch of Nikke and a whisper of Honkai Star Rail. Also some Phantasy Star Portable 2 Infinity on PSP!

Steve wrapped up and enjoyed Star Wars Jedi: Survivor (except for that stupid map), and so has gone back to Another Crab’s Treasure. He also played the first few hours of Alone in the Dark on PS5 and trawled through FromSoftware’s back catalogue to play Ninja Blade on 360 – his PC version is stuck in German, somehow?

And aside from being disappointed by the final act of Destiny 2’s story after The Final Shape, Tuff’s been playing “writing a CV” for the first time in 28 years, which is both a new and old experience.

Now then, what have you been playing?
